name: SetFirewallConfiguration
description:
Update firewall configuration with specified rules.

This tool sets or overwrites the firewall configuration with the provided rules and settings on Vercel.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project to configure the firewall settings.

parameters.name: firewall_configuration
parameters.description: JSON object specifying firewall rules, custom rules, IP settings, and other configurations. Includes details like enabling firewall, managed rules, custom ruleset (CRS), specific rules, IP actions, and bot ID configurations.

sd.description: Scanner Detection - Detect and prevent reconnaissance activities from network scanning tools.

ma.description: Multipart Attack - Block attempts to bypass security controls using multipart/form-data encoding.

lfi.description: Local File Inclusion Attack - Prevent unauthorized access to local files through web applications.

rfi.description: Remote File Inclusion Attack - Prohibit unauthorized upload or execution of remote files.

rce.description: Remote Execution Attack - Prevent unauthorized execution of remote scripts or commands.

php.description: PHP Attack - Safeguard against vulnerability exploits in PHP-based applications.

gen.description: Generic Attack - Provide broad protection from various undefined or novel attack vectors.

xss.description: XSS Attack - Prevent injection of malicious scripts into trusted webpages.

sqli.description: SQL Injection Attack - Prohibit unauthorized use of SQL commands to manipulate databases.

sf.description: Session Fixation Attack - Prevent unauthorized takeover of user sessions by enforcing unique session IDs.

java.description: Java Attack - Mitigate risks of exploitation targeting Java-based applications or components.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team for which the firewall configuration will be updated.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.
